guide.content: Catch the Stars
We are programming the Robotic Arm to collect the stars.
Task 1: Configure the Robotic Arm
Before we start programming the Robotic Arm, we will first have to configure it by writing this piece of code:
The code below will allow us to include all the functions we need to program the Robotic Arm. Functions are group codes required to achieve a specific task.
#include "RobotArm.h"

We now need to specify the length of each part of our Robotic Arm. Where the height of the base is 0.5 units, the lengths of the first and second arms are 1.05 units, and the length of the third arm is 0.45 units.

// Define length of each robot arm link
float linkLengths[] = {0.5, 1.05, 1.05, 0.45};
Let's create the configured Robotic Arm object which will contain all the functions we need to program our Robotic Arm.

// Create our robot arm object.
RobotArm robotArm(linkLengths);
Now it is your turn to write the code to setup your Robotic Arm!
Task 2: Setup the Program
To setup the program, write this piece of code:
Specify how the Servo Motors (the components which moves the Robotic Arm) are attached to the Arduino Uno (the computer that controls the Robotic Arm).
int motorPins[4]={8,9,10,11};
Let's now create a connection between our Arduino Uno and our computer.
Serial.begin(9600);
And finally, let's configure the connection of our Robotic Arm.

// Setup the pins for our virtual robot
robotArm.ConfigurePins(motorPins);
Now it is your turn to write the code to setup your program!
